content.question: The velocity of a particle moving in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> seconds is given by the vector-valued function <math alttext="v"><mi>v</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="v open parentheses t close parentheses equals open angle brackets x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close angle brackets"><mi>v</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 cos open parentheses t minus 1 close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals t squared minus 3 t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi></math>, which of the following is true about the motion of the particle on the interval <math alttext="0 less than t less than 2 pi"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math> ?

choices.label: The particle is moving to the right on the intervals <math alttext="0 less than t less than 1"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="4.142 less than t less than 2 pi"><mn>4.142</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, because on these intervals, <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is positive.

The particle is moving to the right on the intervals <math alttext="0 less than t less than 1"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="4.142 less than t less than 2 pi"><mn>4.142</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, because on these intervals, <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is increasing.

The particle is moving to the right on the intervals <math alttext="0 less than t less than 2.571"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2.571</mn></math> and <math alttext="5.712 less than t less than 2 pi"><mn>5.712</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, because on these intervals, <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is positive.

The particle is moving to the right on the intervals <math alttext="0 less than t less than 2.571"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2.571</mn></math> and <math alttext="5.712 less than t less than 2 pi"><mn>5.712</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, because on these intervals, <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is increasing.

content.answer: The particle is moving to the right on the intervals <math alttext="0 less than t less than 2.571"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2.571</mn></math> and <math alttext="5.712 less than t less than 2 pi"><mn>5.712</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, because on these intervals, <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is positive.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
